intro: Euphrasia chumbica, commonly known as the Andean eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and humid conditions. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Euphrasia chumbica is often used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
